info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 8:39PM EDT until April 16 at 6:17AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
East Fork White.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
Big Blue River at Shelbyville.
East Fork White River at Columbus.
Flatrock River near Columbus.
.Major flooding will continue on the East Fork White. The crest on the East Fork was in between Columbus and Seymour this evening and should reach Rivervale on Tuesday. The Flatrock near Columbus was falling, and the Driftwood at Edinburgh was near crest this evening. The next chance for more than a tenth of an inch of rain does not return until Wednesday.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...East Fork White River near Bedford.
* WHEN...Until Wednesday, April 16.
* IMPACTS...At 32.5 feet, Flooding affects more than 40 homes and over 100 Lawrence County residents in the Fort Ritner, the Fort Ritner Museum, White River Cabins near Williams, low areas of East Oolitic and locally known Chase Riffle and Palestine.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 24.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM EDT Sunday was 24.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 33.2 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday, April 15. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Monday morning by around 1145 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY, APRIL 16
